Reviews.Author: Cristina
Reviews.Content: I feel terrible giving them 3 stars, since the waiter was over the top amazing! The food however, wasn't 'bad' , but my husband ordered basil chicken and I ordered another chicken dish ... And they both had the exact same and so did the chicken lettuce wraps.  :( The Tum Yum was spicy, with not much flavor. Bummer, as I live right down the street and have been dying to find a good Thai place close by.

Reviews.Author: Jennifer
Reviews.Content: If you want pho.... Don't get it here. Staff is friendly and helpful but food is not up to par. Tastes like the broth was made from bouillon cubes.

Reviews.Author: William
Reviews.Content: I'm very conflicted with this place. The food is great, this is the only Pho place close by and that is somewhat decent. Rare Steak Pho is really delicious when I don't want to drive across time for my favorite place.  The service here is usually awful. I've waited for half an hour for a to go order when I have had people come after me get their order quicker.  I have never dined in, but from the look and the wait I witnessed it wasn't all that great. One time they had a woman who seemed almost completely new trying to work the register by herself and taking 8 minutes to ring up an order, she had to grab a cook's help to finish it out.  The regular guy I see that takes orders can be a bit rude. I've been placed on hold for over ten minutes with him to then have to call back.  I have also ordered to go some Pho and Fried Rice, literally he said 'not a problem, we are out of pho since over half an hour.' How is this not a problem?  I also always order my Pho without bean sprouts, he has questioned me as if why I would ever do such a thing and then time after time there are always bean sprouts.  But yet I keep coming back because it is close and pretty good food. They definitely need better help though.

Reviews.Author: Brittany
Reviews.Content: Let me start by saying that I have no idea why this place has so many negative reviews. So, if you're considering going here, but hesitant because of the reviews, I challenge you to try it. You won't regret it.   With that being said, as I pulled up to Jasmine Express, I was a little worried because of the cigar store next door. When I tried Viet Bistro at Tenaya and Lake Mead, it was disgusting because of the cigar smell. But anyways, as I walked in, I was greeted immediately. I ordered a milk tea boba and redeemed my free eggrolls coupon for my Yelp check-in to start. Very prompt service. My boyfriend and I both ordered Pho, as he was not feeling well. I got the rare steak pho. It was absolutely amazing. The flavor was incredible.   I have ZERO complaints about this place. I will definitely be back, sooner rather than later. So glad I finally found a place I can get pho that's not all the way in China town.

Reviews.Author: Zowie
Reviews.Content: Absolutely love this place! Every time im in Vegas I have to come here. I usually get the chicken Phö to help with my hangovers lol. & they're Vietnamese coffee is YUM! & gives you that extra energy. The shrimp spring rolls are also good

Reviews.Author: Annabelle
Reviews.Content: I was in the mood for Pho. I saw they had it from the pictures. Andrea was quick to tell what they had since I didn't have a menu.  Our order was ready for pick up when promised. I like that they pack everything separate and you put it together yourself. Can't wait to go back and try other items.

Reviews.Author: Diana
Reviews.Content: We went based on the reviews and we were pleasantly surprised. We only tried the combo pho and the combo vermicelli, but they were both good. My husband liked the ice coffee too. The service and variety were fine. The food is better near Chinatown, but that doesn't mean this place wasn't good for what we had. I do think the AC needs to be turned up. Good Vietnamese food near Aliante.

Reviews.Author: Meredith
Reviews.Content: We have ordered here a few times and there food has been great.  We ordered food on 11/1/2013 and the chicken we ordered was so bad.  I called to tell them about how awful the chicken was and the man on the phone was extremely rude.  All I wanted them to do was refund the money or make us a new order of the chicken!!  He kept saying well no one else has complained.  Really????  I am a customer who is telling you part of my meal was bad and you could not just fix the problem, instead the man kept putting me on hold and coming back on the line and getting louder and ruder.  I will never recommend anyone here EVER!

Reviews.Author: Ashlee
Reviews.Content: Not really a sit down restaurant but great if your looking for Boba tea to go. They have lots of flavors to choose from. Food is still good.

Reviews.Author: Henry
Reviews.Content: Bad food, bad service & long wait times. Avoid if possible, if not I Hope you have better luck than I did.

Reviews.Author: Dev
Reviews.Content: Service and timing are really lacking, but the food is good. First, we've (fam of 4) always had our food delivered and this time decided to dine-in. I'll either stick to delivery or have to place our dine-in order 20-25 minutes before arriving and hope that they have our small order ready to serve at one time instead of 10 minutes apart on a not so busy night. There were only 3 tables occupied including ours..the other two tables were couples. One table complained because they served the dude the rare beef pho and not the well-done. So hearing that and experiencing what we did with our order, I'd say to make sure they repeat your order back to you. Try their other fried rice, they're tasty...the regular kind is a waste of $.

Reviews.Author: Elaine
Reviews.Content: We've been coming here for the past 2 years. The food was good then but I don't know what happened? The food had gotten worst! Even that...food was AWEFUL! I ordered some Vietnamese food that I've been normally ordering. Today, the looks and taste of it is totally different. The salt and pepper shrimp that is supposed to be fantastic was very very oily and soggy. The Vietnamese spring roll with shrimp was smelly and yucky, ended up not eating it. The Chinese broccoli with oyster sauce was so over cooked and it was floating in its sauce. The fried rice was dark brown, it was overloaded with soy sauce.  I  complain about it but they did not even offer to exchange it or make a new one. Not even an apology for this AWEFUL meal.   Jasmine Express you are done in my book! And for all of you out there who wants to try....Don't! You will be very disappointed!  AWEFUL..AWEFUL...AWEFUL !!!! BAD FOOD...consider this as a warning! DO NOT EAT HERE!!!

Reviews.Author: Maritess
Reviews.Content: Came here for an early dinner. As we walked in, we were not greeted. I grabbed a menu and we sat down at a table. With a check in on Yelp, you get two free vegetable egg rolls. Cool!   The young guy working the front gave us waters and gave us a while to decide on what to get on the menu. We started with some egg rolls mixed meat. Those were delicious as well as the vegetable ones. I start off with a lychee green tea no boba. I did not want to fill up on boba. The lychee green tea was delicious! They have lunch specials that end at 4 pm. We got there at 3:30. Just in time. I decided on chicken tempura with fried rice. The chicken tempura was good. Chicken dipped in tempura batter. So juicy and crunchy at the same time. It came with the dipping sauce which tasted like soy sauce. So good. The fried rice was good with some pieces of egg and lots of soy sauce which made the rice tasty. I love some good fried rice!   Service was great by our young waiter. He cleared our table as soon as we were done with our plates. It seems as if people come here more for the boba drinks! So good and they have so many flavors.

Reviews.Author: Antoinette
Reviews.Content: Chinese and Thai food awful. Vietnamese food...meh. Boba also meh. Enough to tide me over when I can't get to Chinatown. And they deliver (sometimes) when I'm super lazy.

Reviews.Author: Keather
Reviews.Content: Hot and sour soup is very bitter. It is almost like it is made of pure sour. Food is decent. My husband enjoyed the rice. It was mediocre Chinese food.

Reviews.Author: Karla
Reviews.Content: I wasnt a big fan of pho...but this place changed my mind. I USUALLY just drive here but it can be a hassle finding seats since it is small, but now they do online ordering and delivery. Wayyy more convenient for me. I definately recommend the smoothies and the pho...coconut and pineapple is my fav!!!

Reviews.Author: JoAnne
Reviews.Content: Walking in randomly I saw they had boba milk...it was an experience...it didn't taste right and to top it off the boba was still hard in the middle and it was full of ice...not worth the $4.05 if you ask me...could get one for a better price and with a better taste down the street..will not be going back..

Reviews.Author: Nick
Reviews.Content: Better pho than that other place in north town and I love boba smoothies, saves me a drive to china town.

Reviews.Author: Amy
Reviews.Content: Three solid stars for the taste of the food alone. Chicken pad thai was a bit on the sweet side for me but noodles were cooked perfectly and portions were huge. The pork pad se eww...hands down one of the best dishes like this that I have had. I could have eaten this for days. The meat was hearty and there was plenty of it. I will return for the food.   They also have smoothies and boba here. The avacado smoothie was sooooo yummy! Get one!   I could have gone one more star but we waited for 25 min for a to go order...we were the only people in there. The chef made out order wrong and we had to wait longer. In that time I noticed the place could use a deep clean...it's also not in a great part of north Las Vegas so the sidewalk foot traffic was a bit sketchy.   Check in on yelp and get 2 free veggie rolls!!

Reviews.Author: Roger
Reviews.Content: The best way I can describe this place is that it's a Chinese/Thai/Vietnamese fusion type of restaurant. You can get Chow Mein, Pad Thai, or Pho.   My wife shared a bowl of beef pho with my youngest son. My oldest son got the pork vermicelli bowl. I got the lunch special which came with hot or iced tea, eggflower soup, an eggroll, fried rice, and entrée of your choice from a list. I chose sweet n sour pork.   The beef pho was good. Since we ordered it plain, for my youngest, it was just like chicken noodle soup but with beef instead. The vermicelli was ok. Nothing to rave about. Now my lunch special was pretty good. They give you a nice bowl of eggflower soup. I chose iced tea for my drink. I think it was jasmine. It was very strong. If you refer to my pic, the fried rice that came with my sweet n sour pork was very good. The eggroll I think was a combination pork and vegetable. I would say it was a good deal for 6 bucks.  Service was ok. We were taken care of by one server. Even though the place was a bit busy, we got our food in a timely manner. It just took a while to get our refills a couple times.  Some random info: 2 free eggrolls on check in. Free wifi. Password is express7. Lunch specials are everyday from 11 am to 4 pm. Don't forget about the various boba drinks you can order. Apparently a lot of people come here just for those drinks! When we were eating our meal, at least 4 people came in just for those drinks alone! So it must be good. Next time we will try one.  Yelp 2014 365 Review Challenge #75

Reviews.Author: Johnathan
Reviews.Content: First time here, better than I thought. A+++++ no complaints here. Will be a regular for my pho fix!

Reviews.Author: Earl
Reviews.Content: I have been coming here for a few months now and Jasmine Express is still the best in Las Vegas compared to what China Town has to offer. The service is excellent. Chris and everyone who works here are really nice and treats the customers courteously.

Reviews.Author: Manami
Reviews.Content: You know a place is not doing so well when they offer deals that are too good to be true. Free eggroll with yelp check-in and buy one get one free drink? We paid less than $10 and ended up with 2 drinks and a box of eggroll.   SERVICE I was disgusted by the rude servers here. They seemed nice at first but as soon as they saw me check-in on yelp, they kept demanding me to write a review for them. No.  I sat down at one of their sticky and nasty table then they yelled out  you write review? I need to see it  When I went to the counter to pick up my order, they snatched my phone from my hands and started scrolling through my yelp profile.  where is the review? you didn't write it? omg no why  First of all, you have no right to touch my belonging and second of all, it's invasion of my privacy for you to be looking through my phone. I am done with their trashy and unprofessional employees.   FOOD/DRINKS I don't know what their vegetable eggroll was made out of but it was inedible. Straight to trash.   Boba milk tea? or did they mistake this for sugar milk tea? perhaps they added a whole bag of sugar in my 24oz milk tea because I didn't write a review? Either way, I could not drink this. I went home, dumped half of the milk tea, added water and I was finally able to drink this. Took a sip then went straight to trash.  Boba was a disgusting mush and had absolutely no flavor or chew.  CONCLUSION  Never again. Avoid at all cost.

Reviews.Author: Jessica
Reviews.Content: By far the best chinese I have had!  I love chinese food but most places I go upset my stomach as well as my husband's.  This place seemed fresh, not too greasy, and super delicious!  I prefer fried rice but I must admit I love the fluffiness of this white rice.  The staff was friendly and the restaurant clean.  Most definitely my new go-to place for chinese cuisine!

Reviews.Author: Mike
Reviews.Content: worst Pho I ever had. the meats were frozen. in fact it was so frozen that it stillnjad frost on them. not to mention that I wanted to dine in and they bagged everything to go.  Who doest that?

Reviews.Author: Janette
Reviews.Content: Yea I went there 3 times on Thursday with my brother, then I went my cousin & my goddaughter Emma Saturday, then Monday this evening I went with my cousin, her husband & my goddaughter again. I love Jasmine Express. I like the Chow Mein & the pork yummy yummy.

Reviews.Author: Neat
Reviews.Content: I love this place. I went back 3 days in a row trying different items. And the staff was awesome too.... funny guys :)  the boba green tea with kiwi is what has me. its awesome... thanks guys for the great food and service. See you again... :)

Reviews.Author: Faron
Reviews.Content: Me and my girlfriend come all the time, since we moved. It's really close to our house and it has awesome boba and food! it also has a lot of choice and options :) yum

Reviews.Author: Amineh
Reviews.Content: Great Thai food! Best smoothies, so yummy! Hubby and I ordered our fav orange chicken with fried rice.

Reviews.Author: Jennifer
Reviews.Content: Had the pho today to go and it was delicious.  Everything was packed nicely and was still warm when I got home.

Reviews.Author: Xiomara
Reviews.Content: Definitely a thumbs down. Seriously I'm not a picky eater at all. I'm usually the one that thinks everyone is crazy cause I think the food is good and everyone thinks it sucks. Not in this case!  First of all, their sign says hey open at 11am. I got there at 11:30 and their doors were locked but all signs said open. I thought I was retarded for a minute so I called and they just forgot to open the doors. I was seated by 11:36 (you just choose wherever) and was ready to order 2min later. The guy took 15 minutes to come & take my order! Then let me tell you how long I waited to get my food........ At 12:34pm!!!!!! Literally waited 1 whole hour for my food! And I was their only customer!! I was already frustrated but was expecting at least good food. Not the case! It didn't even look good! Had 2 bites and I was done! Not even my 1yr old that eats EVERYTHING wanted some.   So disappointed. Never ever again will I return. The only good thing was their Thai Tea Boba (really good actually) I guess that's where they get their 1 star. Besides that, save the trip and go else where!

Reviews.Author: Youniquely
Reviews.Content: My family and I have been coming here for several years now and we just love this place. Their food is good and tasty and very affordable. I'm so glad that they started doing bobas now coz back then they didn't have it. Now they have tons of flavors to choose from. But my favorite here is the tofu salt & pepper, beef & broccoli, orange chicken, pho and so on. Everything is a must try except for pork coz we don't eat them. But come check it out. Big shout out to Chris for working so hard

Reviews.Author: Juddi
Reviews.Content: Closest pho from my house.. Not as good as the ones close to china town but it'll do! Waiter is always friendly and service is quick. But if u want pho in north Vegas this is the place to go.

Reviews.Author: Vida
Reviews.Content: I was very hopeful and excited about going to Jasmines. Upon entry, my excitement changed when i was seated. The restaurant was filthy, the menus were so sticky that i literally had to pry the pages apart, yeah disgusting. Then it took a long time just to get my appitizers. The silver wear and soup spoons looked like a biohazard. When i finally got my main dish Pho, the bean sprouts were slimy, brownish/black. I literally almost ran out of the restaurant, but the waiter brought some fresh bean sprouts. I was so traumatized by the lack of cleanliness and rotten food that i couldn't eat my food. I would HIGHLY suggest to NEVER dine here. I'm sure they have failed multiple health inspections.  Zero stars

Reviews.Author: Kyle
Reviews.Content: Their Vietnamese dishes are on point; vermicelli, pho, and rice plates. The smoothies are also on point. Everything else, from what I've tried; Chinese dishes (orange chicken, lemon chicken, shumai), Thai dishes (curry, pad thai), aren't all that great. The spring rolls, egg rolls, pork buns and sesame balls are pretty awesome too.

Reviews.Author: Ophelie
Reviews.Content: In the restaurant, there were two other tables occupied with 2 ppl each. My server came over to take my order, however I needed a little time since this was my first visit. During this time, 1 of the 2 tables emptied and I'm still waiting to place my order. I ordered hot tea and grilled chicken with rice noodles. I waited, and waited, and waited. Almost drank the whole pot of tea. Finally went to the counter and told them I wanted my order to go. I glanced back in the kitchen and there were two people (1 older female and male) besides my waiter. The lady who seemed to be doing most of the cooking was not wearing gloves and she plated someones food with her bare hands and then wiped her hands on her clothes. No one in the kitchen wore and apron, nor did I see hand or paper towels.  So that's another I will check off my list. My chicken wasn't half bad. Would just prefer more sanitary conditions.

Reviews.Author: Bryan
Reviews.Content: I had eaten here in 2014 and it was an experience... thought i would give it another as maybe they were having a bad day.  I had the BBQ pork vermicelli (it tasted old) pork was chewy and fatty wasn't impressed same experience i had before! dinning room and bathroom was also dirty again. wont be back for a third time.

Reviews.Author: Stac
Reviews.Content: I keep trying this place cause I liked the pho and combo egg rolls. But everything else wasn't good.  Pad Thai was awful and pink. Tried the mango and sticky rice twice both times took one bite and tossed. Wasn't sweet at all. Tried Thai curry and that wasn't Thai curry. No coconut milk ,potatoes or carrots. So I will no longer stray from the 2 things I like. Oh and I like the teas

Reviews.Author: Melissa
Reviews.Content: Do not request your order for delivery. Took us almost 2 hours to get our food and we are still waiting. Very disappointing! We called to find out what's going on, someone picked up, then hung up on us. Never eating here again.

Reviews.Author: Nicole
Reviews.Content: This place is reliable and tasty. Pad Thai is my fave. I also like their boba options. Im glad a place like this is on this side of town. Service is brisk and cold, which makes me feel like I'm inconveniencing them or something. Maybe it's a cultural difference. I'll still going though! Can't pass up the food and boba.

Reviews.Author: Crystal
Reviews.Content: You know you've ordered from a place too many times when you walk through the door and the owner shouts your name and address.  But we can't help it. My husband and I love Jasmine Express. The chicken wings are crispy and served on a bed of shredded cabbage and sliced Serrano peppers. Little bits of chicken skin fall to the bottom of the pile, and the  resultant mix is even better than the actual wings.  The Singapore noodles have a complex melange of flavors that make me want to read Dune and whisper  the spice...!  between mouthfuls.   The potstickers are equally delightful, as are the cream cheese wontons. Fried rice fans should try the basil fried rice. Better yet, order it extra spicy.  They even have Boba tea - my favorite is the lychee.  Unlike the previous reviewer, we've always had fast service here. Deliveries arrive hot in less than 30 minutes, and take out orders are even faster.

Reviews.Author: Scarlet
Reviews.Content: Came here today for some boba tea unfortunately they didn't have any made so I tried the kiwi pearls in my mango and strawberry smoothie...it was *bomb* I loved it. I still like boba but the pearls are yummy to. I give this place a 5 star and recommend you guys to try the smoothies with pearls. :)

Reviews.Author: Linh
Reviews.Content: They have special offer for boba but they added some extra fees and it's not cheap after all. One time I came there, only ordered 1 thai green boba, it only took like 2 mins to make but they made me wait 15 mins and restaurant was empty. Today I came again and ordered 3 thai green. I waited 20 mins and they made it wrong! Bad service. Won't come back again...

Reviews.Author: andy
Reviews.Content: I come here at least once a week for my lunch break. They have lunch specials from 11am-3pm ranging from $6-$8, but I come here for the Combination Pho. I think it's the best dish they offer. This is probably the only place that serves Pho on this side of town.  Call ahead to order your food, because they take a long time.

Reviews.Author: Priscilla
Reviews.Content: I've been here a few times and I always leave very disappointed.  I'm officially done with these people. Horrible service and mediocre food.

Reviews.Author: Tary
Reviews.Content: Since we live far from China Town , this is the closest place for Pha.. I was surprise to find it fresh n tasty .. I am happy with my new discovery spot and would highly recommend it to friends .

Reviews.Author: Claudia
Reviews.Content: I wouldn't recommend eating here now.   Went to the restaurant after work to order dinner.  After paying I sat and waited, only to find 2 dead German cockaroaches dead in the lobby area of restaurant. Got my money back!

Reviews.Author: Alejandra
Reviews.Content: This place is horrible the pha Thai taste like shit never getting pha Thai from here the Mochi tasted old the stuff is rude never coming back

Reviews.Author: Matt
Reviews.Content: We got takeout from Jasmine Express about a week ago. It was decent, but not incredible. The Mongolian Beef was very good, the dumplings and fried rice were okay, and the Orange Chicken was just meh (didn't even taste  orangey  at all). I would recommend JE, however, my wife and I actually prefer New China Cuisine which is right across the street. Overall their food is better and they do combo family meals which helps keep the price down a bit compared to JE.

Reviews.Author: Kelsey
Reviews.Content: this place is a joke... I came in and ordered 2 smoothies and they made me wait 25 minutes for 2 drinks... they gave us a straw that had sticky substance on it... WTF. it was expensive for no reason and the smoothies weren't even tasty. NEVER COMING BACK.

Reviews.Author: Noe
Reviews.Content: Pretty chill place. Good for the money! Also, there's a lot of specials that include free food or drinks.  Buy 2 Thai teas, get the third free.  Etc. Awesome.

Reviews.Author: Parisa
Reviews.Content: I came in on a Thursday at 11 for lunch. Service was horrible. The main guy seemed out of it and took about 7 minutes to get me water and take my order. Then I got half of the lunch special about 10 minutes later. I was missing the soup and egg roll. The waiter never came back to check despite asking for the check when I got the food. I finally had to go up to the counter because I needed to be back for work and the server had never come back. They did give me a discount which is good Food wise - not bad. I had the shrimp with veggies and was pleased. The fried rice was soaked in soy sauce and wasn't my favorite. The Thai tea - the main thing I came for was horrible. It was WAY too sweet and they had no boba.  Perhaps I went too early. I would try this place again but would probably call in my order and carry out. I hoping their food continues to be decent so I have a good Asian place near me but I don't know I they'll be worth the hassle and the wait.

Reviews.Author: Kay
Reviews.Content: By far the wost 40$ I've spent at an Asian restaurant. Came in ordered and everything was ready in ten minutes. The food tasted recooked, old,  mircowaved. Not worth what I paid. Will never come here again!! Totally gross. Panda Express is better and that's saying something because they have crappy food too.

Reviews.Author: Hillary
Reviews.Content: I used to love this place, service was always super friendly and fast but the last few times I've been sorely disappointed. I generally only come here for the pho, been here 3 times in about 4 weeks, 2 times they were out of pho and boba, last week took 35 minutes for take out, 1 other person came in, ordered and was out before I was. Tonight was the last time I will ever come here. Service was terribly slow (only 1 other table that came in after us, who got their food and drinks before us) were out of sate pho AGAIN, was half way through my meal before I got my Thai tea while my other parties got there's almost right away. Didn't get more water, checked on once. We had to get up and ask for our check so we could get out of there.  Time for a new pho place in north Las Vegas.

Reviews.Author: Jack
Reviews.Content: I love their salt and pepper pork chops! Of course they are way greasy but they taste soooo good!

Reviews.Author: Deborah
Reviews.Content: This is my first review but felt the need to post.  Used groupon so gave them a 3 star for the value.  Like groupon and they generally work out good for me.  Ordered S&S pork and Kung Po Chicken both were just OK.  Fried rice also meh to ok.  Red sauce/sweet? came with the order but had some kind of burnt pieces floating around in it, not sure if that is the way it was suppose to be but I've never seen it before.  Crab Rangoon-way over cooked wontons-filling was OK but skimmpy.  Tempura Shrimp-skinny, dry and hard-close to inedible.  Veg Egg rolls-inedible-had to throw away.  I am not a picky eater but literally could not bite thru the egg rolls.  Sorry will not be back.  Maybe the Pho food is better.

Reviews.Author: Maria
Reviews.Content: Good food lots of choices for boba tea. The service was very good the only thing I was not sure about was I ordered chicken pho and my wife ordered rare steak but the broth was the same and I am not use to that. Thou it was good pho. We will definitely be back soon. The stamp discount is great as well.

Reviews.Author: Beatriz
Reviews.Content: Good food despite their sanitary issues first time I tried was pretty good food. Now I live too far so can't get food from this place.

Reviews.Author: Jessica
Reviews.Content: Yay, bobaaaa! :) I've become addicted to boba and I've been looking for places open later in the day since I get off work late.  I had seen Jasmine Express on Yelp a few times but was afraid they didn't have enough choices for drinks for me. Finally, we decided to come here. My boyfriend was hungry and I wanted boba. I read reviews and everyone talked about how amazing the Thai tea was so I decided to get one.  For food, my boyfriend got a vermicelli dish and I got vegetable pad Thai. Delicious but I took most of it home. Same with my boyfriend! The only thing we really couldn't stop eating was the curry puffs. Soooooo effin good, I couldn't stop myself.  We ended up taking a milk tea and a Thai tea home since they are buy 2, get 1 free. The milk tea definitely tastes a little flowery but I liked it. Overall, very happy with the prices and quality.

Reviews.Author: Alisa
Reviews.Content: This restaurant rates. #1 on the worst Chinese fast food list in the country. I have lived in many places and in many states and this  restaurant  is the worst.   We ordered Crab Rangoon & General Tso chicken. The crab rangoon was very small, overcooked and had a smear of who knows what in it. The General Tso chicken had something that resembled paint thinner and smelled like it too. The chicken was the cheapest quality a restaurant could buy. For fear of spending the weekend in the hospital I stuck to the overcooked crab rangoon and some rice. I was desperate!  If you have the iron stomach and complete lack of taste buds to try the food here you might want to avoid the duck sauce. That was nastier than the paint thinner, er the chicken.

Reviews.Author: Anna
Reviews.Content: I like this place. There aren't a lot of good Chinese/Vietnamese restaurant choices up north- unless you're into the usual china-a-go-go type places. People are friendly and courteous and are more than happy to make any order cooked just the way you like it. The food is good too.

Reviews.Author: Caleb
Reviews.Content: The Food is great, the service is slow & the  a/c doesn't work. An it's been that way for a while. I think they need to go the Food Network & have restaurant makeover!

Reviews.Author: Mel
Reviews.Content: OK so... They have a couple of things I'm addicted to, Pho, Boba tea and Spring Rolls. All of which are pretty on point. The Chinese food, ie Mongolian beef or orange chicken have been a hit or miss. Some are good, some are not. I have to say, the Vietnamese menu though that I've tried from here I have no complaints on. Guy at the register is pleasant, pretty friendly, but delivery service can be slow. So if you get delivery give them at least an hour. Restaurant is clean, a lot cleaner than when it used to be just all chinese food. To sum it up, if you like Asian food and you happen to be on this side of North Las Vegas, this place won't disappoint.

Reviews.Author: Amber
Reviews.Content: The fried rice is pretty good (we always ask for no peas no carrots and more bean sprouts and green onions).   I would also recommend the szechuan chicken and walnut shrimp.

Reviews.Author: Aja
Reviews.Content: Might help if they know what their advertising. The cashier didn't even know what I was talking about when I mentioned the yelp post...upsetting. Food was pretty good tho

Reviews.Author: Valerie
Reviews.Content: When I found out there was a place that sold pho near by I was excited. I usually drive all the way to lake mead and the 95 to get pho so I'm so glad this place is close to where I live besides China town. When I got there, there was a few people already waiting and only one guy in front. I got the combination pho and I did have to wait quit a bit but I didn't mind especially since the obvious lack of staff. Not the absolute best pho I've ever had but it was good enough for me to come back. The broth was tasty but not very enriched with the smell of the spices you usually smell. Overall food not bad. Also their website says they open at 10:30am and their door says 11:00 fri-sat. I got there at 11:22am and the guy opened the doors at 11:30 so they probably should be more consistent...

Reviews.Author: Bridget
Reviews.Content: Delicious smoothies!! Yummy!!  I have tríed both honeydew and the coconut smoothies!! I Will be trying the yellow curry chicken today.

Reviews.Author: Nicole
Reviews.Content: I used to love this place. Whenever I'd have a craving for pho or boba this would be MY spot to go. Especially since it is closer to my house than having to drive all the way to China Town.   I came here a couple days ago with my family. My dad likes their duck here so we tried calling a half hour in advance to place an order. My mom was put on hold for a few minutes but the entire conversation we could hear between the man and his customer. She ended up hanging up and we couldn't connect back with the restaurant for at least 20 mins. By that time we had already arrived in front of the restaurant. We ordered the food via phone still. We did a little food shopping because we were told our food would be about a 20 min wait. Once time had passed and we sat at our table, we actually had to wait about another 20 mins for our food. We had ordered half a duck, Hong Kong noodles w/chicken, General Tso's chicken and a Special Combination Pho, and only water for each of us. We were never asked if we wanted refills on our water once we had first sat down and other than when our meals were given to us he never came back to check on us. I don't understand why it would take so long. Other times I've been here my food would be out 10-15 mins after ordering. I wonder where the the waiter Eddie is? He was always great with his customer service and was always very attentive. Now the people here don't even say hi or greet you. The food wasn't very hot when brought to us but it was good.   I came back to this restaurant today because I've been on this teriyaki chicken bowl or bbq beef feen for awhile so I thought why not try the special that they advertise on the window. The combo includes teriyaki chicken with veggies, rice, crab rangoons and a milk tea. I ordered that and made the milk tea a honey dew. I wish he had asked if I wanted to replace the regular milk tea with honey dew when I ordered cuz it was an extra $3.75. So I got a milk tea with the meal and an extra Honey Dew milk tea. I thought I could choose the flavor for some reason, my mistake. I ordered chicken fried rice also because it's Monday and it's on special. I've always liked their chicken fried rice anyway. I ordered for take out. It took 10 mins for my two drinks to be brought out to me and half an hour to get my food. Mind you it was only two items. He didn't even say anything when he gave me my food. No... Have a nice day  or Thank You!  Disappointing.   The bowl itself was ok, chicken was a bit salty. A lot of rice, not enough chicken, veggies or sauce. I personally don't like my teriyaki bowls to be drenched in sauce anyway but this needed a bit more to it. The fried rice was good as usual though. The Honeydew milk tea tasted a little weird but that might be because I'm not used to it but the regular milk tea was good.   I'm not usually disappointed but the food quality has gone down some and the customer service isn't what it used to be.   I'm not going to say I won't be dining here but I'm not going to go here as my first choice anymore.

Reviews.Author: Avery
Reviews.Content: I stumbled upon this location when my gf was under the weather and needed some hot pho to help her feel better. Its a small hole-in-the-wall place right in between Vons and Subway. As I entered in I was greeted by the only server there, Chris. As I was going through the menu for take-out (which is really nice because most of the dishes have pictures) I was noticing Chris' customer service and he was well knowledgeable and very customer friendly. I ordered the Plain noodle pho, Pan fry beef vermicelli, and special combo rice plate which came with 3 eggrolls, shrimp, and grilled pork. Now before I tell you how bomb the food was, I must pause for a little constructive criticism. If you plan on doing a take-out, call in AT LEAST 15-20 min before hand. I seriously waited for 30-35 minutes while sitting down with my back against the glass entrance wall where the waiting seats are with the Sun beaming on my back. A lady to the right of me that came in a little later than I asked me if I called in before or placed an order when I came in because she said she called in 20 min before and has been waiting for 45 MIN - AN HOUR. -which is ridiculous for any restaurant especially when there's very little ppl. Did I mention the sun is beaming down on our backs? I knew I should have gotten that thai tea...lol. The lady also said that the total ambiance of the place changed but the food was always good. That being said, THE FOOD WAS BOMB. Great proportions and decent prices. The Food was actually fresh! -Definitely something you want when ordering from an oriental/asian restaurant with all the seafood and vegetables they utilize.   Great/Fresh food. Great customer service. The only reason I gave 4/5 stars is simply because with just a few arrangements the restaurant can look a lot nicer, And the wait time for take-out was long! Especially with the chairs against the glass entrance wall. But the Food was great and worth the wait. WHEW...lol

Reviews.Author: Troy
Reviews.Content: A year ago this place was GREAT. Now its a shithole with terrible customer service.  They upcharge once you arrive to pick up your food even though the online receipt includes the items.  The first time we figured it was a mistake, the second time in a row was unacceptable. We will never order food here again.

Reviews.Author: Danielle
Reviews.Content: I pass by this place all the time as I frequent the shopping center. We finally went in the other day and it was excellent. Don't let the  hole in the wall  location convince you to pass it up. So good!

Reviews.Author: Michelle
Reviews.Content: Their food is made fresh as soon as you order!  Therefore if you are wanting fast Chinese food like China a gogo or Panda Express which tastes like junk, don't come here. The wait is worth it here! I call my order in, even if I'm going to eat in the restaurant about 10-15 minutes before I arrive to give them a chance to have it ready or get my order in before others.  Their Chicken Noodle Pho Soup is delicious!!!! I eat it at least once a week! The only reason I give them 4 stars is because about 4 times out of 40 plus visits that I've order the Pho soup they must have ran out of cilantro and instead of getting more or informing you that they are out (what is Pho Soup without cilantro??) they just pack it up without and you are disappointed when you get home. At least you could stop and buy your own if they let you know they ran out.  That's my only complaint and that's very minimal for the amount of times I have had their Pho.

Reviews.Author: David
Reviews.Content: Jasmine Express is a solid go to choice to satisfy the need for good Thai on the tastebuds. The menu is s mix of different Asian dishes, mainly Chinese and Thai. The wide variety of drinks are a nice draw, including milk teas and Boba.   I order Thai dishes here, mainly Pad Thai and Panang Curry. They offer full portions at a reasonable price. While I prefer spicier dishes, their medium I would consider mild, the flavor is still full and very satisfying.  I would recommend trying one of the lunch specials before ordering the full entrees to make sure the flavor profile is to your liking.

Reviews.Author: Carlos
Reviews.Content: I keep hoping that it will get better. It hasn't. The food truly lacks flavor & the service is  slow as the dickens !

Reviews.Author: Joy
Reviews.Content: Love this place!  Ate some great Chinese food.  Getting boba as well.  Service is awesome!  Crab rangoons and Szechuan eggplant always yummy!  Their pho here is great too.  Good price and big portions.  Oh and finishing off with the snow cream.  Love that stuff!

Reviews.Author: Mario
Reviews.Content: Found something that looked like a pubic hair on the rim of my glass... I cancelled the order, and will never return.

Reviews.Author: Jacob
Reviews.Content: So I found this place via the EAT24 app as I have two young kids and taking them anywhere is just a joke at this point. So I haven't been into the actual restaurant but I have ordered delivery a half a dozen times. I have one word for the food.. PHO!! I might have a slight addiction to asian noodle soup and theres is exceptionally good! Ive had it 4 times this week and will probably be getting it again tomorrow! I also ordered the Pad Thai and it was pretty good. About a 3 out of 5 for the Pad Thai.

Reviews.Author: Mark
Reviews.Content: Got to love the Spring Rolls and Strawberry smoothie with boba.    The first time I went here, is with the wife.  Since she saw the reviews were very good.  So trusting the yelpers out there, I decided to tag along.  I was kind of skeptical since it was next to a Smith grocery store and a Subway.  It is a decent size place to eat at.  The inside looks nicely decorated and the staff seems really nice.  The seating arrangement was kind of tight in a sense, but we were able to sit and eat in.    I usually have my spring rolls, and they were really good.  I really like their Strawberry smoothie.   I had their teriyaki Bowl, which was good, and decent.  The wife had the Pho and thought it was okay.    My overall thoughts, I would come here for the spring rolls.  But dining in, is okay, but probably during the off time, like after lunch or before dinner.  So if you're in the area, you should try it.

Reviews.Author: Nawal
Reviews.Content: Yep, I'm a fan! My friend and I drove past this restaurant once and one day decided to give it a shot... She got beef and broccoli and I got beef and green pepper. Beef and green pepper is pretty much just like beef pepper steak. It was only a 15 minute wait, so we went next door to smiths to grab some wine and kill time. After reading reviews, I'm curious as to what 'pho' is and how it tastes... that might be the next thing I try!

Reviews.Author: Alex
Reviews.Content: Fist time back in a longggg time! Ordered the pho. Must say it has improved big time! Is it new ownership?? I dunno but I like it and I'll be back!

Reviews.Author: Lauren
Reviews.Content: This place has great food! Szchuan chicken and eggplant are my favorites. It's always fresh and tasty.

Reviews.Author: Jennifer
Reviews.Content: This place has good cheap food.  No complaints...the service was a LITTLE slow considering there we're a ton of people in there, but they did go BUY jallapeno's when I asked for more which was WAY above and beyond. We got the veggie spring rolls, thia tea and pho...it was all really good.  I got a yep appetizer for free and a buy 2 get one free thia tea, which was exciting!  Bottom Line: This is definitely a good Vietnamese place...I'll be going again.

Reviews.Author: Annette
Reviews.Content: We went for lunch, and had the hargow, salt & pepper calamari, and beef stew noodle.  Service was fairly fast, and the food was great!  The portions for the beef stew noodle and salt & pepper calamari were huge!  Had to take home.  Will be going back to try other items on menu.

Reviews.Author: Pita
Reviews.Content: The drinks aren't that bad, but the wait time is ridiculous? 30 minutes for a boba drink. Come on!! They don't apologize or anything.

Reviews.Author: Jennalyn
Reviews.Content: Just doing a review for the drinks! Buy 2 Thai Tea/Golden Milk Tea get 1 Free! Plus when you check in you get 2 free eggrolls. The man at the cash register was very nice and friendly.

Reviews.Author: David
Reviews.Content: This is the best Chinese ever! My wife loves the Hot and Sour soup and orders it regulally, they now know her and treat her very well, sometimes with fried rice and other times with spring rolls. It is always amazing!

Reviews.Author: Tyrus
Reviews.Content: The combination Pho is amazing, the price is on point. I have returned time and time again. Love it

Reviews.Author: lisa
Reviews.Content: This place has improved quite a bit since the last time I visited. I must say that their phô is just as good as the ones in china town. The portion size is good and the price is average. Definitely will be a place I will continue to go to for my phô cravings and Thai tea bobas!  Even bigger plus is that it's right in the north Las Vegas neighborhood.

Reviews.Author: Joelle
Reviews.Content: It's hard to find good Chinese food anymore, especially with delivery. This place got the job done. Did it blow my mind? Eh, not really, but it had some high points.  I found the chicken fried rice totally awesome. Just salty enough, great flavor, really good.  The sweet n' sour chicken was good, but they should consider putting the sauce on the side when doing delivery. It was very soggy, so I ended up pulling off the outsides and just eating the middle.  The lo mein would've been good -- the chicken in it was white meat and cooked well - but the noodles were way overcooked (again, likely due to the delivery time), so they were mush. And I though it was a little bland.  The pork wontons I really liked. My boyfriend didn't like them as much because he really likes those kinds that are just a big fried noodle with a tiny dot of meat in the middle. These have more meat, but are still quite good, in my opinion.  The crab rangoon was... average. Cooked well, tasted fine. I'd order those again, but they weren't a stand-out, really.  The steamed rice was cooked well and not mushy or underdone.  The whole thing, including delivery tip was $40 or so, not too bad and they were right on time -- 30 minutes.  I'd order from here again, though I might try some other items that won't sog-out, preferably something with vegetables!

Reviews.Author: Anna
Reviews.Content: Two nights in a row had issues ordering online.  First, they said they were slammed for St. Patrick's day and asked if I could come pick it up.  Second night, they said that the coupon I used from their online site wasn't valid.  When I asked when they were getting it fixed, the person who called rudely told me they had fixed it already.  When I told me that I had used it and gotten the coupon from the site, I was told I was wrong and that I ordered the wrong thing.  Then, they started making all these excuses as to why the are having issues, something about a server...So if you want to eat there, you'll have to go there in person.

Reviews.Author: SC
Reviews.Content: I had to come here to change my review. Thai tea was still amazing but that doesn't matter to me after my latest experiences. I signed up for their reward card and loyalty program. Buy 9 get the 10th boba drink free. I reached my 10th drink in less than 10 days. I was there religiously. The service became so disgusting as time went on. Cashiers had an attitude all the time but I ignored it b/c I loved the tea. I go to cash in my  loyalty  card and 3 employees have a conversation about the card for a minute (in their language I don't understand). Finally they honor THEIR card. If that wasn't enough I noticed the boba just sitting there completely uncovered. I will never grace them with my presence again. Customer service is paramount to me & they clearly don't get that. Don't waste your money on these people. I'll drive 30 minutes across town before I support businesses like this.

Reviews.Author: Natali
Reviews.Content: I'm not normally a Chinese food fan, but I've been craving it like crazy lately! We had an excellent experience this past week at Jasmine Express. Any place that delivers is a plus in my book... especially when it arrives much before the said time and is delicious & piping hot! We had beef broccoli, house fried rice, & the walnut shrimp. All of them were fantastic. I have a new found love for walnut shrimp, AMAZING! The only down side was they said they didn't have brown rice which I did see on the menu. 4 stars!

Reviews.Author: Unlovable
Reviews.Content: Great eggplant/tofu. Large portions. Very nice counter ladies- the younger one has it more together. I like that they have Perrier which I rarely find anywhere. They gave us free soda & appetizer with our order. It's nice inside for what looks like a take out place- stay clear of huge plant if you wish to see the tv ..lol.

Reviews.Author: Coreena
Reviews.Content: Tried this place for the first time and it was awful.   The beef vermicelli tasted like the meat had gone bad.  I threw it out and cooked instead. Don't waste your money.

Reviews.Author: Mira
Reviews.Content: I'm kind of confused by Jasmine Express. They're a Vietnamese, Chinese, Thai fusion type of place which makes ordering off the menu for delivery a little trying at best. I ordered steamed pork buns and I had envisioned the flaky bbq pork buns I've had at dim sum. These are not those buns. They're a bit more pasty and chewy in texture. I was a bit disappointed in that.  Their shrimp spring rolls are quite fresh and vibrant served with a side of peanut sauce. I find it a refreshingly light fair for the hot Vegas summers. Their fried rice could use some more flavor although it is already dark brown from the soy sauce but needing a kick of some sort. My order of General's chicken was extremely mild but on the upside it was overly breaded. It was nice big bites of chicken with very little breading. I'll just have to ask for it a bit spicier than I had ordered.  JE's vegetable egg rolls were nice and crispy. Mongolian beef was a good portion and tender. Next time I'll try a few different items as it seems their Chinese side of the menu is a bit week but their Vietnamese side is strong.

Reviews.Author: Brian
Reviews.Content: I wanted crab fried rice but they use the face stuff so I pass on it. I'm not sure who the guy was working behind the counter but he suggested  I try their dinner special rock crab with salt and pepper for $14.00This had to be on of the best dishes I ever eaten! The portions was huge,If I was back in jersey and or something like this it would have cost more line $25. This was the best $14 I ever spent!!

Reviews.Author: Paul
Reviews.Content: Totally disappointed. This was my 4th time eating here and quite possibly my last.   First, I ordered the speciality fried rice (The server described it as  the white fried rice and not the dark ) It came with chopped pork, chicken and whole shrimp. The shrimp had their intestinal tracks still intact. The chicken was really dry which makes me think they used old leftover pre cooked chicken. And the rice was hard and some pieces were crunchy. When fried rice gets stuck in my teeth, it's not good fried rice.   I also ordered the rare beef Pho. When the server brought the plate of Jalapenos, bean sprouts, and thai basil, the jalapenos were dry and rotting, the basil came wilted and had a lot of brown spots. I asked her to change it out and she did.   Usually whenever I get Pho, it comes steaming hot. Since I only saw little puff of steam, I knew I was in trouble. I went to stir it and the noodles on the bottom were still clumped together, and a small ice cube was in the noodles! I pulled it out and kept stirring the Pho to loosen the noodles. Usually when I get the rare beef, the soup cooks it because its so hot. Not this time... After I tasted it, I called the server over and asked her if she could warm it up in the microwave because it was luke warm. After 15 mins, the little old lady in the back came out with the Pho and said that if I order rare beef it will stay rare. I told her that was fine, but I didnt want cold soup.   When I got the Pho back, I could tell she just boiled the hell out of it because it was full of floaters from the cooked blood from the rare beef. It just looked disgusting. I couldnt eat it, and asked for my check. Instead of making things better, the server just gave me the check and I paid 25.00 for NOTHING. (I did drink my Thai tea)    There was a total lack of service. There was only one other person during my entire visit. Nobody ever really checked on my table. And it was hard to get the servers attention when I needed something.   I am really surprised at the quality of the food, because their sister restaurant Da Lat is outstanding. I thnk the manager or chef at Da Lat needs to pay Jasmine a visit....

Reviews.Author: Carole
Reviews.Content: Tried this place for the first time last week and we were VERY happy with everything we tried.  We ordered egg fried rice, veggie egg foo young, shiu mai, chicken noodle soup, won ton soup and pepper steak.  Seriously, everything was really very good!  The soups especially were a great surprise....all the noodles were the homemade long egg noodles.  Yummo!    As the previous reviewer stated, the service does take a little longer than your normal take out place, but it's well worth the wait.    The service is outstanding and everyone was very friendly.    I highly recommend Jasmine Express!!!

Reviews.Author: Diego
Reviews.Content: Food was great...  One plate is enough for two to eat and the pho rare steak soup very good.. Area clean .....

Reviews.Author: Jen
Reviews.Content: First and last visit to eat. Food was awful - canned mushrooms, questionable water chestnuts, mushy rice!  Pad Thai mediocre. Spring rolls eh. Only saving grace were the boba drinks. Overwhelming grease smell (stuck in my clothes!).

Reviews.Author: Jasmine
Reviews.Content: VERY DIRTY establishment. Potstickers were incredibly bland. Took one bite, complained to the MANAGER and was told I ordered it so I had to pay. I wasn't complaining to not pay. .ughh REALLY BAD EXPERIENCE. My husband and daughters food were mediocre at best. Never again.

Reviews.Author: Nika
Reviews.Content: They have boba milk teas here in North Las vegas.   Eddie was excellent cashier. Bogo on milk teas and smoothies (:

Reviews.Author: Erika
Reviews.Content: Food was greasy. It was hot in there and service was ok. Food was alright. I give them ONE whopping  bleh  star and ANOTHER as a thank you for the free egg roll upon checking-in through Yelp. :-p

Reviews.Author: Amanda
Reviews.Content: This place had high stars on Postmates and I needed Thai food... extremely disappointed.  6 dollars for the worst, cheapest spring rolls I have ever eaten... literally. Check out the photo of them.   I also got my favorite Tom Ka soup.. definitely the most lacking Tom kha I've ever had.   I wish i had more to say, this is probably the most vague review I've ever posted, but I'm currently just meh.. I'd rather drive 15 minutes and get Thai to go rather than order from here again.

Reviews.Author: Ana
Reviews.Content: So the boba here is good, depending on who makes it. The food is hit or miss depending on what time of day you get it. I usually get Pad Thai here and sometimes it's fantastic, sometimes you wonder what the hell they put in it. Needless to say, I got food poisoning this last time around so I think I'll just stick to the boba. Other than that, the staff is pretty cool. It'll do in a pinch.

Reviews.Author: Khey
Reviews.Content: I got a txt from this location saying I got 10% off I told the guy regarding to txt and rudely told me that they will stop that  soon. I been coming for this place every  for the buy 2 get 1 free boba. It took 20 mins to make my boba when I'm the only customer during at that time, trying to get one of the guys attention but got ignored til the lady saw me and told me  that the machine is not hot enough for the boba cup to be sealed.

Reviews.Author: michelle
Reviews.Content: A - ok  with me!!!  Oh my what a feast of food........  clean, fresh, and great customer service. all of their vegetables are fresh, well everything.  I had crab ragoons, bok choy, rice, and vermacelli noodles......chicken,...salad......o man i wish i could remember the name of the meal!!!! soooooooo gooood......bye, going to lunch getting hungry thing\king about it.

Reviews.Author: Diana
Reviews.Content: This is my favorite place to get pho however recently when I've been getting it delivered something is always off. One time the limes were old and the broth wasn't up to par. Obviously was a bad batch but this time was the last straw! They put pho in a big styrofoam soda cup which is totally fine, perfect serving, but the top was a soda cup top with the hole in it so naturally when it's being delivered it has the possibility of getting knocked over and spill a little bit but half of my pho was spilled in the bag with the spicy sauce melted in the plastic container with the broth.This would not have happened if they put it in their usual container. I'm very unhappy with this service today!

Reviews.Author: Evan
Reviews.Content: The food and service was not up to par last time we ate there it was great this time it was bad. We waited more than 20 minutes for someone to come and give us menus and take our order it took a long time to get drinks, hey gentleman walked in went to the counter waved sat down and was served his food before we even got our food and we have been there 20 minutes prior to him walking in. Do not eat the chili sauce we lifted the lid there was black mold we informed the waiter of the mold and he just took the container and moved to another table and nor did he ask us if we would like to have a fresh batch of chili sauce as for the food it was not up to par, not fresh and like I said the service suck. We know if we're going to ever go back again.

Reviews.Author: Marvin
Reviews.Content: Good Pho, Thai ice tea with boba buy 2 get one free.....doesn't get any better than this.

Reviews.Author: Theresa
Reviews.Content: This is really more of a 2 star rating...but given there are not too many options in North Las Vegas....relative to the area and the options available, it gets 3 stars.  It's pretty much a glorified panda express menu with some Thai/Vietnamese offerings.  We tried the Vietnamese food....the grilled pork&shrimp, egg rolls, rice option and the similar vermicelli bowl option. The meat was rather dry and slightly on the salty side.  The egg rolls were quite mediocre and flavorless inside.  The noodles were cooked well....We also tried the fried chicken wing appetizer...and they were tasty but perhaps that was due to the excessive use of MSG as seasoning...none the less it was crispy goodness but I probably drank 3 glasses of water after the appetizer.  Will I come back?  Perhaps....there are just those days when I'm too lazy to drive....

Reviews.Author: Adlai
Reviews.Content: After wanting to get some good quality viet food but being to lazy to drive to China town, my wife and I decided to check this place out. First impression was ugly decor, poor ventilation, and the fruits in the storage looked like they were rotting. But that has never stopped me from eating good quality food, so we went ahead and sat down. My wife was happy when she they had a young coconut drink. Saw the dude pull it out of the rotting fruit section. I tried it and felt it was disgusting, my wife said it was good. Egg rolls were terrible, and I ordered the special combination vermicelli and my wife ordered the egg roll vermicelli. Long story short food was bland and not worth the price. I highly doubt we will ever visit this establishment again.

Reviews.Author: Amanda
Reviews.Content: I've been to this place a couple times now and it's always great! They have very friendly service and great food! I've had the seafood pho both times and the aroma & flavor if the broth is the best I've had!

Reviews.Author: Max
Reviews.Content: I really like Jasmine Express. I usually order the family meal as the best bang for our buck. I first came here in around 2001 when I first moved to El Dorado. I REALLY liked it when they used to make their orange chicken from scratch. It was way better than it is now and what Panda was putting out. I stopped by tonight and was very happy with what I received to the point of me wanting to write a review and put Jasmine Express back into my fast-food rotation.  To me their food tastes better than other offerings in the area. I like how Roger T. describes their menu as a mix between Chinese, Thai and Vietnamese. I gave four stars instead of five because when I went in to pick up my phone ordered food, the counter person chose to clear tables in an empty restaurant first and had me wait till he was done before ringing up my food which was sitting on the counter waiting for me. Meaning this restaurant needs to improve on its customer service in order to get better reviews.  As far as bugs, I have never seen any here but I've seen mice running around a Jack In The Box (not the one in this shopping center) and had a roach IN my food at another popular chinese restaurant. That was a no-go. My point is there are rodents, rats and roaches all over this desert town we call Vegas. Don't be fooled. Keep your eyes open.

Reviews.Author: Miesha
Reviews.Content: The food is fresh, cooked to order and the portions are generous for the price. We ordered the Shrimp Egg Foo Young and egg rolls. Myself, my husband and three year old son ate two meals from the one order.   The only downside was that it took close to 45 mins for our order to be prepared. The food was worth the wait.   So it's best to call in your order a head of time.

Reviews.Author: Cassandra
Reviews.Content: What with the frequency I've been visiting Jasmine Express, I think it's time I updated my review from a 3 star rating to an improved 4 star rating. Jasmine Express is an Asian fusion restaurant located off Ann & Camino Al Norte in the large Smith's shopping center. So why the update? Jasmine's vegetarian pho ($7.65) nursed me back to health (I may be exaggerating) when I was sick with a persistent cold. When I find myself eating solo for dinner, I get huge portions of take-out food with a 5-7 minute wait time here. Plus, how awesome is that Yelp check-in offer for two free egg rolls with any purchase? I love those vegetable egg rolls!   Most importantly, ever since I've discovered Boba and Thai Tea, Jasmine Express has been instrumental in catering to my addictions. They're open until 10PM most days, which is the latest Boba shop you'll find open around these parts. They have a huge drink menu with tons of choices and varieties. My husband and I have tried the Thai Tea ($3.75), Taro Smoothie ($.4.25), and Mocha Tea Smoothie ($4.25). That mocha tea was unbelievably good! I've been feigning to try their mint chocolate smoothie next.    Heads up though - customer service needs some major improvements. Just know that before coming in. They're not very knowledgeable on menu items and don't speak much. I wouldn't recommend dining in because service is slow and it tends to be very warm inside. It's very take it or leave it. Regardless, I have to say I'm a fan of Jasmine Express!  UPDATE: Jasmine Express has a military discount! Yay!  YELP 100 CHALLENGE 2015: #180

Reviews.Author: Evee
Reviews.Content: soo addicting!!!! I live in Henderson and I went here because my cousin lives in N.las vegas and told me about this place. I love the beef combination pho soup!!! Sooo bomb! They said no msg...hmmm...but still soo good! I am craving for more at the moment. Restaurant is clean and friendly staff, and also tried the chow mein which was very tasty as well!!! 5stars!

Reviews.Author: Hannah
Reviews.Content: I was craving pho so I ordered the well cooked beef pho for delivery. It was very bland and quite disappointing. The broth was put in a separate to-go cup from the veggies and meat so nothing had flavor. My boyfriend ordered the General Tsao's chicken and said it tastes better at other places. The egg roll was good but that's pretty hard to mess up. All in all, I won't be eating here again.

Reviews.Author: Junnel
Reviews.Content: Service was good, place was clean. The food menu has great selection but i will say the taste is ok but  HANDS DOWN  to their pho soup!!! worth of a drive if you're in the north side & craving for pho soup noodles . Will be back only for that.

Reviews.Author: Summer
Reviews.Content: I have given this place chance after chance. I don't know why they have the elderly man still making the food. I have nothing against him personally and give him respect for trying, but it's clearly time to retire. The food is HORRIBLE! I order two orders of Egg Foo Young for me and my friend. That was $25 down the drain because neither of us ate more than 1 of the 4 patties it came with! It was the WORST EFY we have both ever eaten. I feel bad because it was my idea to go there! I will NEVER give this place my money again!

Reviews.Author: Kae
Reviews.Content: First time experience here. Got there at 8:30 pm on a Wednesday night. The place was empty, no customers. Told the server we wanted to eat for dine-in but was told that they close at 9pm and was just staring like he wanted nothing from us. Walked out without even trying their food. No remorse, no apologies from the host. Just pure laziness. The sign on the front said they close at 930 and yelp hours say they close at 10pm.   Tip for future customers: if you want to dine-in, don't go at 830 if they close at 930 because really, they close at 9 and your service will be refused.  Really wanted to try their food and would've ordered to-go but based on that performance, I was incredibly disappointed in their customer service. Never going back again.

Reviews.Author: Mercy
Reviews.Content: They have the worst pho I've ever had! If you want pho better go to Chinatown. Their seafood pho sucks monkey balls a million times. Their shrimp in the seafood pho taste old, rubbery, and is just nasty. I do not recommend it at all. The noodles are hard. Service was bad. Just don't ever get pho here!!

Reviews.Author: A.
Reviews.Content: WARNING: Stay away  from this place. we ate there a few times with no problems. this last time my wife found what turned out to be a piece of steel wool in her fried rice.!  took it back and showed it to the employee. he thought it was no big deal! he barely said sorry. needless to say i won't be going back!

Reviews.Author: Shannon
Reviews.Content: A decent Chinese resturaunt i must say. Food was good and came out very presentable. The hostess barely speaks English so its hard to explain a specialty order and hard to understand her coversation but she's very nice.  The building was very clean with spacious seating. There's one t.v. to watch and I'm sure you could arrange to have the channel changed to whatever you like.   Not too expensive due to have a lunch special. Very chill and relaxing and did I mention how good the food is? Lol  I ordered the kung pao chicken which was amazing!! A bit spicy but I expected it to be. Not stingy with the chicken and evened out with vegitables.  Overall, the place is amazing and is proud to have Yelpers eat the restaurant because they have a big sign at the register that thanks fellow reviewers such as you & I.  Will definitely be eating here again soon.

Reviews.Author: Kate
Reviews.Content: There are a lot of Chinese restaurants around here.  Unfortunately they all kind of taste the same.  The food here was good, but nothing stood out as extraordinary.

Reviews.Author: Christina
Reviews.Content: I really like this place when I need to satisfy my Pho kick! The Pho is always delicious, and ordering pick up is always very quick. I always order a Thai iced tea with boba and usually they are on point, but this time it seems that they have switched their boba. The boba instead of being the large balls are now the small tiny ones. Still good none the less, I just prefer the normal boba size balls.

Reviews.Author: Sandra
Reviews.Content: Probably has to be one of the worst sit-down restaurant experiences I've ever had. The service is overlook-able. i ordered the beef noodle pho. The broth itself is pretty bland and felt like a chore to eat. It was a herbal beef broth with a slight sweet taste to it. Nothing special. The noodles were alright and the vegetables (Bean sprouts, cilantro, onion; the lime was a little dry) were fresh.   The bad rating comes from the beef. The actual beef muscle was okay but the beef tendon tasted pretty spoiled. I've eaten soups, including herbal soups with beef tendon. That did not come close to the weird nasty taste this tendon had. Quite overpriced as well. Better/similar prices in other locations. Would recommend New China Cuisine right across the street. Kinda similar but at least the beef was decent quality and the portions are great.

Reviews.Author: Sandy
Reviews.Content: We come a lot here but they had changed their hours from 11am to 12pm for opening. It's 1225pm and no one has showed up..not only did they lose customers but they show no consideration for their customers to at least put a sign up if they are not opening! Finding another pho place that will appreciate us.

Reviews.Author: Royal
Reviews.Content: I went to this place today because I was craving shrimp fried rice. The decor was very nice there was a nice family there eating and the customer service was great ....however my rice was not what I really wanted the shrimp wasn't cooked along with the rice and it did not taste as good as I would have liked! So I pretty much left disappointed and I threw the 8 dollar rice in the trash ...but everything looked good! I'm always willing to give places a second chance! So I may be going back

Reviews.Author: Mia
Reviews.Content: Not too many Vietnamese/Chinese place in NLV. This is my go to when I don't wanna make the drive out. It does the job. Good food. Cheap prices. :)

Reviews.Author: Jaz
Reviews.Content: Wanted to eat pho but didn't want to travel, this place popped up as closest to us. The Service was ok. Food not great. I ordered pho beef meatball and the noodles were overcooked and mushy. We probably won't be coming back here again. Taking the longer drive is worth it for better quality food.

Reviews.Author: John
Reviews.Content: My local Chinese spot never disappoints me... Good service (for a Chinese restaurant at least) fresh and fast I go at least 4x a month!

Reviews.Author: Porsche
Reviews.Content: I was sooooo disappointed with my experience all the way around...  We ordered online for delivery and it took about an hour and a half before they knocked at the door....The delivery site is something to be desired as it's not user-friendly.  Then, at the end, the  delivery fee  (not tip) went up from 3.00 to 5.00...not sure what the deal was there. I guess the upside is that the delivery woman was at least nice...but then again, I don't think it would've been a good idea to NOT be and it took an hour and a half *shrug*...suggestion, DON'T add the tip to your order if you pay with a CC, do cash, as we -pre-tipped really well and it bit us in the bottom.  Ordered quite a variety so we could get a feel for the place, plus we were STARVING:  -Vegetable eggrolls- very greasy, not unusual for eggrolls so *shrug*  -salt and pepper wings- deep fried and super tiny, like pigeon-wing tiny. Nothing special about them whatsoever...and considering how long it took before we got our order, they were pretty stale on arrival  -hot and sour soup- it was so  gelatin-y  and didn't taste good. I ve had better at the walk-up places at mall food courts. I poured it out  -Pad Thai- just tasteless and dry  -Cashew Chicken- another  gelatin-y  dish. Nothing to  write home about  even if I write about it on Yelp :)   -BBQ fried rice- looked like it was cooked in a really dirty wok, and it didn't taste good either. Tasted like old grease with chunks of dried-up pork in it  We spent a good 50.00, but regretted it. Would've done better to just get up off the couch and drive to Panda, considering the poor quality JE gave us  I doubt seriously that I would eat there (or from there) again and, not to be mean, but I wouldn't tell anyone I know to eat there either.

Reviews.Author: Daniela
Reviews.Content: It is ridiculous how long you have to wait for a chicken teriyaki bowl ... Like 45 minute wait time when theres no one in the lobby ? Plus the guy that took our order was so rude , when we tried to add something to the order he was like  what do you want  terrible service and the bowl was  ok  teriyaki maddness next time smh

Reviews.Author: Michelle
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend mentions his craving for their orange chicken everyday when we pass by driving home. My favorite is the crab rangoons. They had a special buy an order of rangoons, get one free, so we got a total of 12 and I polished off the majority of them. They're always really friendly! And don't forget to put some of their boba balls in your mouth, sho good.

Reviews.Author: Nichole
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend first discovered this hole in the wall because it was right next to Smiths, however it's an awesome thing he did because I LOVE the food there. I'm not big fan of Chinese food but this place changed my perception for the better. The lunch special that they have is really cheaper and you get a lot of bang for your buck. Depending on what main entrée you get it can range from $6.00 per plate to about $12.00, the meal includes soup of the day, the entrée, egg roll, and a huge helping of their amazing fried rice and the best part it actually comes with either iced/hot green tea with free refills. I personally like the basil chicken, it was large pieces of chicken as well as fresh vegetables.   I've tired many pho places and Jasmine Express has a legit broth which as you probably know with pho is a key element in the pho. I found it to be flavorful and I enjoyed every bite.

Reviews.Author: Ruben
Reviews.Content: Meh. I've experienced better.  Here lies my meager attempt to find some good pho.  I can't go too long without some, and strangely enough, it seems to be a rarity near me.  They seem to specialize in Chinese food, but all I was interested in was the Vietnamese.  Hard to screw up pho for me.  All it needs is the right ingredients and just take a hot minute to get to me.  I'll probably blame the usual clientele for the limited pho selection, but I have also seen worse.  This is the first time I've seen tendon pho all by itself; usually it's along side tripe and other meats.  This could have been very disappointing as I don't typically see a lot of tendon in pho, but no, they were generous here.  On the other hand, for an establishment that prides itself on fresh ingredients (even says so on the menu), their condiments were far from such.  The lime, basil, and sprouts looked far older than I cared to guess.  I drowned them in the hot broth before I decided they might be unappetizing -- except the sprouts as they were just too far gone.  Maybe if they hadn't called so much attention to their ingredients, I would have been more lenient.  Noodles and broth were sufficient in quantity and quality.  Here's a little story: I had a tad too much sun earlier that day and was quite burnt.  I know: strange that I would want hot pho after being sunburnt, but I just had to have it.  They had the plus of being an all Asian staff; I almost prefer it when there was a language barrier to overcome -- typically a sign of authenticity.  And I found some of that with the waitress.  Now there was one exchange that I just wasn't understanding, but after a bit of back-and-forth, turns out she was asking me if I was drunk because of my red face.  While funny at the moment, it sadly once again made me think of what kind of clientele they have to put up with to require that kind of question.  At least she was nice about it.  Another interesting note was the television had a soccer game on in Spanish.  This was a first for me in an Asian establishment, and I'll have to be forgiven for asking about it.  Turns out the owner himself likes it and speaks it.  Supposedly the regulars expect nothing less.  It was these experiences more than the pho that might make me return.

Reviews.Author: Jason
Reviews.Content: Well Shucks.  I wanted to like the local Chinese joint, but I was underwhelmed two times.  I had the basil chicken.  It just didn't taste very good - I really can't explain it.  The fried rice was real dark with nothing in it.    I can't remember what I got the second time I went... I did see crickets crawling around the floor both times I was there.  This is basically your typical local Chinese restaurant.  It is probably okay if you just want to stop by and get a quick cheap lunch.

Reviews.Author: Diana
Reviews.Content: Very misleading and disappointing! My family and I have been coming to this place for years! It seems tho that the restaurant has either changed owners or cook. Today's visit was due to a certificate of $10 I got from restaurants. com. Food was bad last time I came (about a month ago) but I decided to give it another chance. Unfortunately it was worse this time. I Un-wrapped the utensils from the enclosed napkin and got a dirty used fork! My parents orded the Kao pao chicken and i ordered the chicken chow main.  When the food came, the rice was hard like it wasn't even cooked. When I asked for the bill and showed my  restaurants.com certificate for $10, they only creditedy bill for $9.19. When I questioned the amount the server said  Yea, everyone knows that.  Well NO. When you buy a certificate for a certain amount, you expect the business to credit the full advertised amount. Just a bad experience over all. I have I e more $10 certificate left and to be honest, I feel like throwing it away. No sense to going back for bad food And false advertising.

Reviews.Author: Lei
Reviews.Content: the food quality is not consistent. the wait is oh so looooonnnggg, every single time. once, i called in my order and gave them 45 minutes to prepare my food, and when i arrived at the restaurant, i waited another 20 minutes. and while i paid as soon as i got there, i was asked by staff if i had already paid before handing me my food. today will be the last time i set my foot here, because you made me wait again...oh jasmine express, you keep breaking my heart!
